fiber noun
(MATERIAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C/U ] any of the thin parts like thread that form plant or artificial material, esp. those that can be made into cloth, or a mass of such parts twisted together: [ C ] Police detectives found cloth fibers at the crime scene that matched those from the coat the suspect was wearing.
[ C/U ] Fiber can also refer to thin, strong structures that connect the body: [ U ] muscle fiber
fiber noun
(CHARACTER)
[ U ] the quality of a person’s character, esp. its moral strength: He lacked the moral fiber to be president.
fiber noun
(FOOD)
[ U ] the part of foods eaten that is not digested but that passes through the body and is excreted as waste: Doctors recommend a diet of fruits, vegetables, and grains that are high in fiber.
